#!/usr/bin/env python3
import requests
from bs4 import BeautifulSoup

def scrape_page(url):
    """Scrape a simple webpage."""
    print(f"Fetching: {url}\n")
    
    # Add headers to mimic a browser
    headers = {
        'User-Agent': 'Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36'
    }
    
    response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
    
    if response.status_code == 200:
        soup = BeautifulSoup(response.content, 'html.parser')
        
        # Extract title
        title = soup.find('title')
        print(f"Page title: {title.text if title else 'No title'}\n")
        
        # Extract all links
        links = soup.find_all('a', href=True)
        print(f"Found {len(links)} links:\n")
        
        for i, link in enumerate(links[:10], 1):
            print(f"{i}. {link.text.strip()[:50]} -> {link['href']}")
        
        # Extract all paragraphs
        paragraphs = soup.find_all('p')
        print(f"\nFound {len(paragraphs)} paragraphs")
        
        return soup
    else:
        print(f"Error: {response.status_code}")
        return None

if __name__ == "__main__":
    import sys
    
    if len(sys.argv) < 2:
        url = "https://example.com"
    else:
        url = sys.argv[1]
    
    scrape_page(url)

#!/usr/bin/env python3
import requests
from bs4 import BeautifulSoup
import time

def scrape_products(url):
    """Scrape product information from a page."""
    headers = {
        'User-Agent': 'Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36'
    }
    
    print(f"Scraping products from: {url}\n")
    
    response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
    
    if response.status_code != 200:
        print(f"Error: {response.status_code}")
        return []
    
    soup = BeautifulSoup(response.content, 'html.parser')
    
    products = []
    
    # Example: Find all product cards (adjust selectors for target site)
    # This is a generic example
    product_elements = soup.find_all('div', class_='product')
    
    if not product_elements:
        print("No products found with class 'product'. Trying alternative selectors...")
        # Try alternative selectors
        product_elements = soup.find_all('article') or soup.find_all('li', class_='item')
    
    print(f"Found {len(product_elements)} potential products\n")
    
    for element in product_elements:
        # Extract product name
        name_elem = element.find(['h2', 'h3', 'h4', 'a'])
        name = name_elem.text.strip() if name_elem else 'Unknown'
        
        # Extract price (common patterns)
        price_elem = element.find(class_=['price', 'cost', 'amount'])
        if not price_elem:
            price_elem = element.find(string=lambda text: '$' in str(text))
        price = price_elem.strip() if price_elem else 'N/A'
        
        # Extract link
        link_elem = element.find('a', href=True)
        link = link_elem['href'] if link_elem else ''
        
        products.append({
            'name': name,
            'price': price,
            'link': link
        })
        
        print(f"Product: {name}")
        print(f"  Price: {price}")
        print(f"  Link: {link[:60]}..." if len(link) > 60 else f"  Link: {link}")
        print()
    
    return products

if __name__ == "__main__":
    import sys
    
    url = sys.argv[1] if len(sys.argv) > 1 else "https://example.com"
    products = scrape_products(url)
    print(f"\nTotal products scraped: {len(products)}")

#!/usr/bin/env python3
import requests
from bs4 import BeautifulSoup
import time
import csv

def scrape_with_pagination(base_url, max_pages=5):
    """Scrape multiple pages with pagination."""
    headers = {
        'User-Agent': 'Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36'
    }
    
    all_items = []
    
    for page in range(1, max_pages + 1):
        # Common pagination patterns
        # Pattern 1: ?page=N
        url = f"{base_url}?page={page}"
        # Pattern 2: /page/N
        # url = f"{base_url}/page/{page}"
        
        print(f"Scraping page {page}/{max_pages}: {url}")
        
        try:
            response = requests.get(url, headers=headers, timeout=10)
            
            if response.status_code != 200:
                print(f"  Error: {response.status_code}")
                break
            
            soup = BeautifulSoup(response.content, 'html.parser')
            
            # Extract items (adjust selector for target site)
            items = soup.find_all('div', class_='item')
            
            if not items:
                print("  No items found. End of pagination.")
                break
            
            for item in items:
                title_elem = item.find(['h2', 'h3', 'a'])
                title = title_elem.text.strip() if title_elem else 'N/A'
                
                all_items.append({
                    'page': page,
                    'title': title
                })
            
            print(f"  Found {len(items)} items")
            
            # Be polite: wait between requests
            time.sleep(2)
            
        except requests.RequestException as e:
            print(f"  Request failed: {e}")
            break
    
    print(f"\nTotal items scraped: {len(all_items)}")
    return all_items

if __name__ == "__main__":
    import sys
    
    if len(sys.argv) < 2:
        print("Usage: python3 scrape_paginated.py <base_url> [max_pages]")
        sys.exit(1)
    
    base_url = sys.argv[1]
    max_pages = int(sys.argv[2]) if len(sys.argv) > 2 else 5
    
    items = scrape_with_pagination(base_url, max_pages)

#!/usr/bin/env python3
import requests
from bs4 import BeautifulSoup
import pandas as pd

def scrape_table(url, table_index=0):
    """Scrape HTML table and convert to DataFrame."""
    print(f"Scraping table from: {url}\n")
    
    headers = {
        'User-Agent': 'Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36'
    }
    
    response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
    soup = BeautifulSoup(response.content, 'html.parser')
    
    # Find all tables
    tables = soup.find_all('table')
    print(f"Found {len(tables)} tables\n")
    
    if not tables:
        print("No tables found!")
        return None
    
    if table_index >= len(tables):
        print(f"Table index {table_index} out of range")
        return None
    
    # Get specific table
    table = tables[table_index]
    
    # Extract headers
    headers = []
    header_row = table.find('thead')
    if header_row:
        headers = [th.text.strip() for th in header_row.find_all(['th', 'td'])]
    else:
        # Try first row
        first_row = table.find('tr')
        if first_row:
            headers = [th.text.strip() for th in first_row.find_all(['th', 'td'])]
    
    print(f"Headers: {headers}\n")
    
    # Extract rows
    rows = []
    tbody = table.find('tbody') or table
    
    for tr in tbody.find_all('tr')[1 if not table.find('thead') else 0:]:
        cells = tr.find_all(['td', 'th'])
        row = [cell.text.strip() for cell in cells]
        if row:
            rows.append(row)
    
    print(f"Extracted {len(rows)} rows\n")
    
    # Create DataFrame
    if headers:
        df = pd.DataFrame(rows, columns=headers[:len(rows[0])] if rows else [])
    else:
        df = pd.DataFrame(rows)
    
    print(df.head())
    
    return df

if __name__ == "__main__":
    import sys
    
    if len(sys.argv) < 2:
        print("Usage: python3 scrape_table.py <url> [table_index]")
        sys.exit(1)
    
    url = sys.argv[1]
    table_index = int(sys.argv[2]) if len(sys.argv) > 2 else 0
    
    df = scrape_table(url, table_index)
    
    if df is not None:
        # Save to CSV
        output = 'scraped_table.csv'
        df.to_csv(output, index=False)
        print(f"\nâœ“ Saved to {output}")

#!/usr/bin/env python3
import requests
from bs4 import BeautifulSoup
import csv
import time
from datetime import datetime

def scrape_and_save(url, output_csv='scraped_data.csv'):
    """Scrape data and save to CSV."""
    headers = {
        'User-Agent': 'Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36'
    }
    
    print(f"Scraping: {url}\n")
    
    response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
    soup = BeautifulSoup(response.content, 'html.parser')
    
    # Extract data (customize for your target site)
    items = []
    
    # Example: scrape all article titles and links
    articles = soup.find_all('article') or soup.find_all('div', class_='post')
    
    for article in articles:
        title_elem = article.find(['h1', 'h2', 'h3', 'a'])
        title = title_elem.text.strip() if title_elem else 'N/A'
        
        link_elem = article.find('a', href=True)
        link = link_elem['href'] if link_elem else ''
        
        # Make absolute URLs
        if link and not link.startswith('http'):
            from urllib.parse import urljoin
            link = urljoin(url, link)
        
        date_elem = article.find('time') or article.find(class_=['date', 'published'])
        date = date_elem.text.strip() if date_elem else datetime.now().strftime('%Y-%m-%d')
        
        items.append({
            'title': title,
            'link': link,
            'date': date,
            'scraped_at': datetime.now().strftime('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S')
        })
    
    # Write to CSV
    if items:
        with open(output_csv, 'w', newline='', encoding='utf-8') as f:
            fieldnames = ['title', 'link', 'date', 'scraped_at']
            writer = csv.DictWriter(f, fieldnames=fieldnames)
            
            writer.writeheader()
            for item in items:
                writer.writerow(item)
        
        print(f"âœ“ Scraped {len(items)} items")
        print(f"âœ“ Saved to {output_csv}\n")
        
        # Show preview
        print("Preview:")
        for item in items[:5]:
            print(f"  â€¢ {item['title'][:60]}")
    else:
        print("No items found")
    
    return items

if __name__ == "__main__":
    import sys
    
    if len(sys.argv) < 2:
        print("Usage: python3 scrape_to_csv.py <url> [output.csv]")
        sys.exit(1)
    
    url = sys.argv[1]
    output = sys.argv[2] if len(sys.argv) > 2 else 'scraped_data.csv'
    
    scrape_and_save(url, output)

#!/usr/bin/env python3
"""Complete web scraping tool."""
import requests
from bs4 import BeautifulSoup
import csv
import json
import time
import argparse
from datetime import datetime

class WebScraper:
    def __init__(self, delay=2):
        self.delay = delay
        self.session = requests.Session()
        self.session.headers.update({
            'User-Agent': 'Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36'
        })
    
    def fetch(self, url):
        """Fetch and parse URL."""
        try:
            response = self.session.get(url, timeout=10)
            if response.status_code == 200:
                return BeautifulSoup(response.content, 'html.parser')
        except Exception as e:
            print(f"Error fetching {url}: {e}")
        return None
    
    def extract_links(self, soup, base_url):
        """Extract all links from page."""
        from urllib.parse import urljoin
        
        links = []
        for a in soup.find_all('a', href=True):
            href = a['href']
            full_url = urljoin(base_url, href)
            text = a.text.strip()
            links.append({'url': full_url, 'text': text})
        
        return links
    
    def scrape_to_json(self, url, output='output.json'):
        """Scrape and save to JSON."""
        soup = self.fetch(url)
        if not soup:
            return
        
        data = {
            'url': url,
            'title': soup.find('title').text if soup.find('title') else None,
            'links': self.extract_links(soup, url),
            'scraped_at': datetime.now().isoformat()
        }
        
        with open(output, 'w') as f:
            json.dump(data, f, indent=2)
        
        print(f"âœ“ Saved to {output}")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    parser = argparse.ArgumentParser(description="Web Scraper")
    parser.add_argument('url', help="URL to scrape")
    parser.add_argument('--output', default='output.json', help="Output file")
    parser.add_argument('--delay', type=int, default=2, help="Delay between requests")
    
    args = parser.parse_args()
    
    scraper = WebScraper(delay=args.delay)
    scraper.scrape_to_json(args.url, args.output)
